_check.errorMessage: check must be either a conditional expression (string) with $fields and operators, or a list (array) of objects { field: condition }.

allOf.description: Must contain at least one $field or a helper call

anyOf.description: Is just a helper call (e.g., exists($x), is_null($y), helper($f, ...))

_checkExpression.description: Conditional expression with $fields/helpers and optionally NOT/AND/OR or comparison operators.

_checkList.description: Checklist: each item is { field: condition }. All must pass in order.
_checkList.errorMessage: Invalid checklist: each item must be an object with exactly one { field: condition } pair. If the field exists in the decoder fields schema, its value must match the type defined there; custom fields are allowed.

additionalProperties.description: Condition: JSON literal, field reference ($field.path), or helper (exists(), helper(args...))

items.description: Each item must be an object with a single { field: condition } pair.

@timestamp.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: date

Date/time when the event originated.
This is the date/time extracted from the event, typically representing when the event was generated by the source.
If the event source has no original timestamp, this value is typically populated by the first time the event was received by the pipeline.
Required field for all events.

The amount of heap memory committed, in bytes. This value represents the amount of memory that is guaranteed to be available for use by the heap, regardless of the actual usage. The value can be adjusted using JVM options to optimize resource allocation for specific workloads.

check.compliance.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

CIS compliance standard under which the check is defined. This field indicates the specific compliance standard that the check is associated with, such as CIS benchmarks or other compliance frameworks.
Note: this field should contain an array of values.

check.condition.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Describes the relationship between the rules. This field indicates how the rules should be evaluated to determine the overall result of the check.
The allowed values are:
  - `all`: All rules must be satisfied.
  - `any`: Any of the rules is sufficient.
  - `none`: None of the rules must be satisfied.

check.description.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Extended description of the check.

check.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The ID of the SCA policy check.

check.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The name of the SCA policy check.

check.rationale.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The reason for the check. Why it is important.

check.reason.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The reason for the check result. This field provides additional information or context about the result of the check. It may include details about why the check passed or failed, any specific conditions that were not met, or any other relevant information that helps to understand the outcome of the check.

check.references.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

References for the check. This can include links to documentation, articles, or other resources that provide additional information about the check, such as Common Configuration Enumeration (CCE).
Note: this field should contain an array of values.

check.remediation.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Actions to take to remediate the check.

check.result.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The result of the check. This field indicates whether the check passed or failed based on the evaluation of the rules. The result is typically represented as a boolean value, where "passed" indicates that the check was successful and "failed" indicates that the check did not meet the specified criteria.

check.rules.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Expression to be evaluated. This field contains the specific rules or expressions that need to be evaluated to determine the result of the check. The rules are typically defined using a specific syntax or format that allows for logical comparisons and evaluations. The rules can include various conditions, operators, and values that are used to assess the compliance status of the system or configuration being checked.
Note: this field should contain an array of values.

IndexerType: keyword

Some event client addresses are defined ambiguously. The event will sometimes list an IP, a domain or a unix socket.  You should always store the raw address in the `.address` field.
Then it should be duplicated to `.ip` or `.domain`, depending on which one it is.

client.as.number.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Unique number allocated to the autonomous system. The autonomous system number (ASN) uniquely identifies each network on the Internet.

client.as.organization.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Organization name.

client.bytes.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Bytes sent from the client to the server.

client.domain.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The domain name of the client system.
This value may be a host name, a fully qualified domain name, or another host naming format. The value may derive from the original event or be added from enrichment.

client.geo.city_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

City name.

client.geo.continent_code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Two-letter code representing continent's name.

client.geo.continent_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the continent.

client.geo.country_iso_code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Country ISO code.

client.geo.country_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Country name.

client.geo.location.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: geo_point

Longitude and latitude.

client.geo.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

User-defined description of a location, at the level of granularity they care about.
Could be the name of their data centers, the floor number, if this describes a local physical entity, city names.
Not typically used in automated geolocation.

client.geo.postal_code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Postal code associated with the location.
Values appropriate for this field may also be known as a postcode or ZIP code and will vary widely from country to country.

client.geo.region_iso_code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Region ISO code.

client.geo.region_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Region name.

client.geo.timezone.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The time zone of the location, such as IANA time zone name.

client.ip.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: ip

IP address of the client (IPv4 or IPv6).

client.mac.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

MAC address of the client.
The notation format from RFC 7042 is suggested: Each octet (that is, 8-bit byte) is represented by two [uppercase] hexadecimal digits giving the value of the octet as an unsigned integer. Successive octets are separated by a hyphen.

client.nat.ip.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: ip

Translated IP of source based NAT sessions (e.g. internal client to internet).
Typically connections traversing load balancers, firewalls, or routers.

client.nat.port.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Translated port of source based NAT sessions (e.g. internal client to internet).
Typically connections traversing load balancers, firewalls, or routers.

client.packets.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Packets sent from the client to the server.

client.port.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Port of the client.

client.registered_domain.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The highest registered client domain, stripped of the subdomain.
For example, the registered domain for "foo.example.com" is "example.com".
This value can be determined precisely with a list like the public suffix list (https://publicsuffix.org). Trying to approximate this by simply taking the last two labels will not work well for TLDs such as "co.uk".

client.subdomain.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The subdomain portion of a fully qualified domain name includes all of the names except the host name under the registered_domain.  In a partially qualified domain, or if the the qualification level of the full name cannot be determined, subdomain contains all of the names below the registered domain.
For example the subdomain portion of "www.east.mydomain.co.uk" is "east". If the domain has multiple levels of subdomain, such as "sub2.sub1.example.com", the subdomain field should contain "sub2.sub1", with no trailing period.

client.top_level_domain.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The effective top level domain (eTLD), also known as the domain suffix, is the last part of the domain name. For example, the top level domain for example.com is "com".
This value can be determined precisely with a list like the public suffix list (https://publicsuffix.org). Trying to approximate this by simply taking the last label will not work well for effective TLDs such as "co.uk".

client.user.domain.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the directory the user is a member of.
For example, an LDAP or Active Directory domain name.

client.user.email.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

User email address.

client.user.full_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

User's full name, if available.

client.user.group.domain.description:
Module: ecs

Name of the directory the group is a member of.

client.user.group.id.description:
Module: ecs

Unique identifier for the group on the system/platform.

client.user.group.name.description:
Module: ecs

Name of the group.

client.user.hash.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Unique user hash to correlate information for a user in anonymized form.

data_stream.dataset.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The field can contain anything that makes sense to signify the source of the data.
Examples include `nginx.access`, `prometheus`, `endpoint` etc. For data streams that otherwise fit, but that do not have dataset set we use the value "generic" for the dataset value. `event.dataset` should have the same value as `data_stream.dataset`.
Beyond the Elasticsearch data stream naming criteria noted above, the `dataset` value has additional restrictions:
  * Must not contain `-`
  * No longer than 100 characters

data_stream.namespace.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

A user defined namespace. Namespaces are useful to allow grouping of data.
Many users already organize their indices this way, and the data stream naming scheme now provides this best practice as a default. Many users will populate this field with `default`. If no value is used, it falls back to `default`.
Beyond the Elasticsearch index naming criteria noted above, `namespace` value has the additional restrictions:
  * Must not contain `-`
  * No longer than 100 characters

data_stream.type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

An overarching type for the data stream.
Currently allowed values are "logs" and "metrics". We expect to also add "traces" and "synthetics" in the near future.

destination.nat.ip.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: ip

Translated ip of destination based NAT sessions (e.g. internet to private DMZ)
Typically used with load balancers, firewalls, or routers.

destination.registered_domain.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The highest registered destination domain, stripped of the subdomain.
For example, the registered domain for "foo.example.com" is "example.com".
This value can be determined precisely with a list like the public suffix list (https://publicsuffix.org). Trying to approximate this by simply taking the last two labels will not work well for TLDs such as "co.uk".

destination.subdomain.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The subdomain portion of a fully qualified domain name includes all of the names except the host name under the registered_domain.  In a partially qualified domain, or if the the qualification level of the full name cannot be determined, subdomain contains all of the names below the registered domain.
For example the subdomain portion of "www.east.mydomain.co.uk" is "east". If the domain has multiple levels of subdomain, such as "sub2.sub1.example.com", the subdomain field should contain "sub2.sub1", with no trailing period.

destination.top_level_domain.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The effective top level domain (eTLD), also known as the domain suffix, is the last part of the domain name. For example, the top level domain for example.com is "com".
This value can be determined precisely with a list like the public suffix list (https://publicsuffix.org). Trying to approximate this by simply taking the last label will not work well for effective TLDs such as "co.uk".

device.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The unique identifier of a device. The identifier must not change across application sessions but stay fixed for an instance of a (mobile) device.
On iOS, this value must be equal to the vendor identifier (https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uidevice/1620059-identifierforvendor). On Android, this value must be equal to the Firebase Installation ID or a globally unique UUID which is persisted across sessions in your application.
For GDPR and data protection law reasons this identifier should not carry information that would allow to identify a user.

device.manufacturer.description:
Module: ecs

Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

device.serial_number.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

This value can distinguish signatures when a file is signed multiple times by the same signer but with a different digest algorithm.

dll.code_signature.flags.description:

dll.code_signature.signing_id.description:

dll.code_signature.status.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Additional information about the certificate status.
This is useful for logging cryptographic errors with the certificate validity or trust status. Leave unpopulated if the validity or trust of the certificate was unchecked.

dll.code_signature.subject_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Subject name of the code signer

dll.code_signature.team_id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The team identifier used to sign the process.
This is used to identify the team or vendor of a software product. The field is relevant to Apple *OS only.

dll.code_signature.thumbprint_sha256.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Certificate SHA256 hash that uniquely identifies the code signer.

dll.code_signature.timestamp.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: date

Date and time when the code signature was generated and signed.

dll.code_signature.trusted.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: boolean

Stores the trust status of the certificate chain.
Validating the trust of the certificate chain may be complicated, and this field should only be populated by tools that actively check the status.

dll.code_signature.valid.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: boolean

Boolean to capture if the digital signature is verified against the binary content.
Leave unpopulated if a certificate was unchecked.

dll.pe.go_import_hash.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

A hash of the Go language imports in a PE file excluding standard library imports. An import hash can be used to fingerprint binaries even after recompilation or other code-level transformations have occurred, which would change more traditional hash values.
The algorithm used to calculate the Go symbol hash and a reference implementation are available here: https://github.com/elastic/toutoumomoma

dll.pe.go_imports.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: flat_object

List of imported Go language element names and types.

dll.pe.go_imports_names_entropy.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Shannon entropy calculation from the list of Go imports.

dll.pe.go_imports_names_var_entropy.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Variance for Shannon entropy calculation from the list of Go imports.

dll.pe.go_stripped.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: boolean

Set to true if the file is a Go executable that has had its symbols stripped or obfuscated and false if an unobfuscated Go executable.

dll.pe.imphash.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

A hash of the imports in a PE file. An imphash -- or import hash -- can be used to fingerprint binaries even after recompilation or other code-level transformations have occurred, which would change more traditional hash values.
Learn more at https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2014/01/tracking-malware-import-hashing.html.

dll.pe.import_hash.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

A hash of the imports in a PE file. An import hash can be used to fingerprint binaries even after recompilation or other code-level transformations have occurred, which would change more traditional hash values.
This is a synonym for imphash.

dll.pe.imports.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: flat_object

List of imported element names and types.

dll.pe.imports_names_entropy.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Shannon entropy calculation from the list of imported element names and types.

dll.pe.imports_names_var_entropy.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Variance for Shannon entropy calculation from the list of imported element names and types.

dll.pe.original_file_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Internal name of the file, provided at compile-time.

dll.pe.pehash.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

A hash of the PE header and data from one or more PE sections. An pehash can be used to cluster files by transforming structural information about a file into a hash value.
Learn more at https://www.usenix.org/legacy/events/leet09/tech/full_papers/wicherski/wicherski_html/index.html.

dll.pe.product.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Internal product name of the file, provided at compile-time.

dll.pe.sections.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: nested

An array containing an object for each section of the PE file.
The keys that should be present in these objects are defined by sub-fields underneath `pe.sections.*`.

entropy.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Shannon entropy calculation from the section.

name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

PE Section List name.

physical_size.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

PE Section List physical size.

var_entropy.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Variance for Shannon entropy calculation from the section.

virtual_size.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

PE Section List virtual size. This is always the same as `physical_size`.

dns.answers.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: object

An array containing an object for each answer section returned by the server.
The main keys that should be present in these objects are defined by ECS. Records that have more information may contain more keys than what ECS defines.
Not all DNS data sources give all details about DNS answers. At minimum, answer objects must contain the `data` key. If more information is available, map as much of it to ECS as possible, and add any additional fields to the answer objects as custom fields.

class.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The class of DNS data contained in this resource record.

data.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The data describing the resource.
The meaning of this data depends on the type and class of the resource record.

name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The domain name to which this resource record pertains.
If a chain of CNAME is being resolved, each answer's `name` should be the one that corresponds with the answer's `data`. It should not simply be the original `question.name` repeated.

ttl.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The time interval in seconds that this resource record may be cached before it should be discarded. Zero values mean that the data should not be cached.

type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The type of data contained in this resource record.

dns.header_flags.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Array of 2 letter DNS header flags.

dns.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The DNS packet identifier assigned by the program that generated the query. The identifier is copied to the response.

dns.op_code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The DNS operation code that specifies the kind of query in the message. This value is set by the originator of a query and copied into the response.

dns.question.class.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The class of records being queried.

dns.question.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The name being queried.
If the name field contains non-printable characters (below 32 or above 126), those characters should be represented as escaped base 10 integers (\DDD). Back slashes and quotes should be escaped. Tabs, carriage returns, and line feeds should be converted to \t, \r, and \n respectively.

dns.question.registered_domain.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The highest registered domain, stripped of the subdomain.
For example, the registered domain for "foo.example.com" is "example.com".
This value can be determined precisely with a list like the public suffix list (https://publicsuffix.org). Trying to approximate this by simply taking the last two labels will not work well for TLDs such as "co.uk".

dns.question.subdomain.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The subdomain is all of the labels under the registered_domain.
If the domain has multiple levels of subdomain, such as "sub2.sub1.example.com", the subdomain field should contain "sub2.sub1", with no trailing period.

dns.question.top_level_domain.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The effective top level domain (eTLD), also known as the domain suffix, is the last part of the domain name. For example, the top level domain for example.com is "com".
This value can be determined precisely with a list like the public suffix list (https://publicsuffix.org). Trying to approximate this by simply taking the last label will not work well for effective TLDs such as "co.uk".

dns.question.type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The type of record being queried.

dns.resolved_ip.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: ip

Array containing all IPs seen in `answers.data`.
The `answers` array can be difficult to use, because of the variety of data formats it can contain. Extracting all IP addresses seen in there to `dns.resolved_ip` makes it possible to index them as IP addresses, and makes them easier to visualize and query for.

dns.response_code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The DNS response code.

dns.type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The type of DNS event captured, query or answer.
If your source of DNS events only gives you DNS queries, you should only create dns events of type `dns.type:query`.
If your source of DNS events gives you answers as well, you should create one event per query (optionally as soon as the query is seen). And a second event containing all query details as well as an array of answers.

email.attachments.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: nested

A list of objects describing the attachment files sent along with an email message.

file.extension.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Attachment file extension, excluding the leading dot.

file.hash.cdhash.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Code directory hash, utilized to uniquely identify and authenticate the integrity of the executable code.

file.hash.md5.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

MD5 hash.

file.hash.sha1.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

SHA1 hash.

file.hash.sha256.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

SHA256 hash.

file.hash.sha384.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

SHA384 hash.

file.hash.sha512.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

SHA512 hash.

file.hash.ssdeep.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

SSDEEP hash.

file.hash.tlsh.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

TLSH hash.

file.mime_type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The MIME media type of the attachment.
This value will typically be extracted from the `Content-Type` MIME header field.

file.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the attachment file including the file extension.

file.size.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Attachment file size in bytes.

email.bcc.address.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The email address of BCC recipient

email.cc.address.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The email address of CC recipient

email.content_type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Information about how the message is to be displayed.
Typically a MIME type.

email.delivery_timestamp.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: date

The date and time when the email message was received by the service or client.

email.direction.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The direction of the message based on the sending and receiving domains.

email.from.address.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The email address of the sender, typically from the RFC 5322 `From:` header field.

email.local_id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Unique identifier given to the email by the source that created the event.
Identifier is not persistent across hops.

email.message_id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Identifier from the RFC 5322 `Message-ID:` email header that refers to a particular email message.

email.origination_timestamp.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: date

The date and time the email message was composed. Many email clients will fill in this value automatically when the message is sent by a user.

email.reply_to.address.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The address that replies should be delivered to based on the value in the RFC 5322 `Reply-To:` header.

email.sender.address.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Per RFC 5322, specifies the address responsible for the actual transmission of the message.

email.subject.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

A brief summary of the topic of the message.

email.to.address.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The email address of recipient

email.x_mailer.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The name of the application that was used to draft and send the original email message.

enrichments.custom.anonymous.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Indicates whether the indicator was reported anonymously by the submitter.

enrichments.custom.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Unique identifier of the indicator.

enrichments.custom.malware.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Malware family or identifier associated with the indicator.

enrichments.custom.malware_alias.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Alternative or secondary name used to refer to the same malware family.

enrichments.custom.malware_printable.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Human-readable or normalized malware name intended for display purposes.

enrichments.custom.tags.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

List of tags associated with the indicator used to classify or group related threats or campaigns.

enrichments.custom.threat_type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

High-level classification of the threat associated with the indicator.

enrichments.indicator.confidence.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Indicator confidence rating.

enrichments.indicator.first_seen.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: date

Date/time indicator was first reported.

enrichments.indicator.last_seen.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: date

Date/time indicator was last reported.

enrichments.indicator.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Indicator display name.

enrichments.indicator.provider.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Indicator provider.

enrichments.indicator.reference.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Indicator reference URL.

enrichments.indicator.type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Type of indicator.

enrichments.source.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Source of the enrichment data identifying the external provider that supplied the indicator.

error.code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Error code describing the error.

error.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Unique identifier for the error.

error.message.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Error message.

error.stack_trace.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The stack trace of this error in plain text.

error.type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The type of the error, for example the class name of the exception.

event.action.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The action captured by the event.
This describes the information in the event. It is more specific than `event.category`. Examples are `group-add`, `process-started`, `file-created`. The value is normally defined by the implementer.

event.agent_id_status.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Agents are normally responsible for populating the `agent.id` field value. If the system receiving events is capable of validating the value based on authentication information for the client then this field can be used to reflect the outcome of that validation.
For example if the agent's connection is authenticated with mTLS and the client cert contains the ID of the agent to which the cert was issued then the `agent.id` value in events can be checked against the certificate. If the values match then `event.agent_id_status: verified` is added to the event, otherwise one of the other allowed values should be used.
If no validation is performed then the field should be omitted.
The allowed values are:
`verified` - The `agent.id` field value matches expected value obtained from auth metadata.
`mismatch` - The `agent.id` field value does not match the expected value obtained from auth metadata.
`missing` - There was no `agent.id` field in the event to validate.
`auth_metadata_missing` - There was no auth metadata or it was missing information about the agent ID.

event.category.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

This is one of four ECS Categorization Fields, and indicates the second level in the ECS category hierarchy.
`event.category` represents the "big buckets" of ECS categories. For example, filtering on `event.category:process` yields all events relating to process activity. This field is closely related to `event.type`, which is used as a subcategory.
This field is an array. This will allow proper categorization of some events that fall in multiple categories.

event.changed_fields.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Fields that were updated since last scan.

event.code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Identification code for this event, if one exists.
Some event sources use event codes to identify messages unambiguously, regardless of message language or wording adjustments over time. An example of this is the Windows Event ID.

event.collector.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Collector used to retrieve the event.

event.created.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: date

`event.created` contains the date/time when the event was first read by an agent, or by your pipeline.
This field is distinct from `@timestamp` in that `@timestamp` typically contain the time extracted from the original event.
In most situations, these two timestamps will be slightly different. The difference can be used to calculate the delay between your source generating an event, and the time when your agent first processed it. This can be used to monitor your agent's or pipeline's ability to keep up with your event source.
In case the two timestamps are identical, `@timestamp` should be used.

event.dataset.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the dataset.
If an event source publishes more than one type of log or events (e.g. access log, error log), the dataset is used to specify which one the event comes from.
It's recommended but not required to start the dataset name with the module name, followed by a dot, then the dataset name.

event.duration.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Duration of the event in nanoseconds.
If `event.start` and `event.end` are known this value should be the difference between the end and start time.

event.end.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: date

`event.end` contains the date when the event ended or when the activity was last observed.

event.hash.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Hash (perhaps logstash fingerprint) of raw field to be able to demonstrate log integrity.

event.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Unique ID to describe the event.

event.ingested.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: date

Timestamp when an event arrived in the central data store.
This is different from `@timestamp`, which is when the event originally occurred.  It's also different from `event.created`, which is meant to capture the first time an agent saw the event.
In normal conditions, assuming no tampering, the timestamps should chronologically look like this: `@timestamp` < `event.created` < `event.ingested`.

event.kind.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

This is one of four ECS Categorization Fields, and indicates the highest level in the ECS category hierarchy.
`event.kind` gives high-level information about what type of information the event contains, without being specific to the contents of the event. For example, values of this field distinguish alert events from metric events.
The value of this field can be used to inform how these kinds of events should be handled. They may warrant different retention, different access control, it may also help understand whether the data is coming in at a regular interval or not.

event.module.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the module this data is coming from.
If your monitoring agent supports the concept of modules or plugins to process events of a given source (e.g. Apache logs), `event.module` should contain the name of this module.

event.original.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Raw text message of entire event. Used to demonstrate log integrity or where the full log message (before splitting it up in multiple parts) may be required, e.g. for reindex.
This field is not indexed and doc_values are disabled. It cannot be searched, but it can be retrieved from `_source`. If users wish to override this and index this field, please see `Field data types` in the `Elasticsearch Reference`.

event.outcome.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

This is one of four ECS Categorization Fields, and indicates the lowest level in the ECS category hierarchy.
`event.outcome` simply denotes whether the event represents a success or a failure from the perspective of the entity that produced the event.
Note that when a single transaction is described in multiple events, each event may populate different values of `event.outcome`, according to their perspective.
Also note that in the case of a compound event (a single event that contains multiple logical events), this field should be populated with the value that best captures the overall success or failure from the perspective of the event producer.
Further note that not all events will have an associated outcome. For example, this field is generally not populated for metric events, events with `event.type:info`, or any events for which an outcome does not make logical sense.

event.provider.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Source of the event.
Event transports such as Syslog or the Windows Event Log typically mention the source of an event. It can be the name of the software that generated the event (e.g. Sysmon, httpd), or of a subsystem of the operating system (kernel, Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing).

event.reason.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Reason why this event happened, according to the source.
This describes the why of a particular action or outcome captured in the event. Where `event.action` captures the action from the event, `event.reason` describes why that action was taken. For example, a web proxy with an `event.action` which denied the request may also populate `event.reason` with the reason why (e.g. `blocked site`).

event.reference.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Reference URL linking to additional information about this event.
This URL links to a static definition of this event. Alert events, indicated by `event.kind:alert`, are a common use case for this field.

event.risk_score.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: float

Risk score or priority of the event (e.g. security solutions). Use your system's original value here.

event.risk_score_norm.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: float

Normalized risk score or priority of the event, on a scale of 0 to 100.
This is mainly useful if you use more than one system that assigns risk scores, and you want to see a normalized value across all systems.

event.sequence.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Sequence number of the event.
The sequence number is a value published by some event sources, to make the exact ordering of events unambiguous, regardless of the timestamp precision.

event.severity.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The numeric severity of the event according to your event source.
What the different severity values mean can be different between sources and use cases. It's up to the implementer to make sure severities are consistent across events from the same source.
The Syslog severity belongs in `log.syslog.severity.code`. `event.severity` is meant to represent the severity according to the event source (e.g. firewall, IDS). If the event source does not publish its own severity, you may optionally copy the `log.syslog.severity.code` to `event.severity`.

event.start.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: date

`event.start` contains the date when the event started or when the activity was first observed.

event.timezone.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

This field should be populated when the event's timestamp does not include timezone information already (e.g. default Syslog timestamps). It's optional otherwise.
Acceptable timezone formats are: a canonical ID (e.g. "Europe/Amsterdam"), abbreviated (e.g. "EST") or an HH:mm differential (e.g. "-05:00").

event.type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

This is one of four ECS Categorization Fields, and indicates the third level in the ECS category hierarchy.
`event.type` represents a categorization "sub-bucket" that, when used along with the `event.category` field values, enables filtering events down to a level appropriate for single visualization.
This field is an array. This will allow proper categorization of some events that fall in multiple event types.

event.url.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

URL linking to an external system to continue investigation of this event.
This URL links to another system where in-depth investigation of the specific occurrence of this event can take place. Alert events, indicated by `event.kind:alert`, are a common use case for this field.

f5_bigip.log.abandoned_conns.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Represents the number of abandoned connections detected by F5 BIG-IP.

f5_bigip.log.accept_fails.description:

f5_bigip.log.accepts.description:

f5_bigip.log.access.policy_result.description:

f5_bigip.log.access.profile.description:

f5_bigip.log.acl.policy.name.description:

f5_bigip.log.acl.policy.type.description:

f5_bigip.log.acl.rule.name.description:

f5_bigip.log.acl.rule.uuid.description:

Unique identifier for the ACL rule in the F5 BIG-IP log.

f5_bigip.log.action.description:
Module: ecs

Action taken by the F5 BIG-IP system for this log entry.

f5_bigip.log.active_conns.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Current number of active connections recorded in the F5 BIG-IP log.

f5_bigip.log.actual_mitigation_action.re.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Reason for the actual mitigation action performed by the system.

f5_bigip.log.actual_mitigation_action.va.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Value of the actual mitigation action performed.

f5_bigip.log.additional_bot_signatures.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Additional bot signatures detected in the F5 BIG-IP log entry.

f5_bigip.log.afm_state.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Current AFM (Advanced Firewall Manager) state for the event.

f5_bigip.log.aggr_interval.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Aggregation interval used for the log entry in F5 BIG-IP.

f5_bigip.log.anomalies.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

List of anomalies detected in the F5 BIG-IP log entry.

f5_bigip.log.anomaly_categories.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Categories of anomalies identified in the F5 BIG-IP log.

f5_bigip.log.apm_state.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Current APM (Access Policy Manager) state for the event.

f5_bigip.log.application.display_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Display name of the application referenced in the log entry.

f5_bigip.log.application.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the application referenced in the F5 BIG-IP log.

f5_bigip.log.application.response.max_ti.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Maximum response time recorded for the application in the log.

f5_bigip.log.application.response.min_ti.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Minimum response time recorded for the application in the log.

f5_bigip.log.application.response.time.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Total response time for the application as recorded in the log.

f5_bigip.log.application_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the application associated with this F5 BIG-IP log entry.

f5_bigip.log.asm_attack_signatures.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: object

ASM attack signature in the log.

f5_bigip.log.asm_state.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Current ASM (Application Security Manager) state for the event.

f5_bigip.log.attack.count.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Number of attacks counted in the F5 BIG-IP log entry.

f5_bigip.log.attack.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Unique identifier for the attack referenced in the log.

f5_bigip.log.attack.mitigation_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the mitigation applied to the attack in the log.

f5_bigip.log.attack.trigger_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the trigger that initiated the attack event.

f5_bigip.log.attack.type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Type of attack detected and recorded in the log entry.

f5_bigip.log.attack.vector_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the attack vector associated with the event.

f5_bigip.log.bad_actor.detection.avg.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Average detection value for bad actor events in the log.

f5_bigip.log.bad_actor.drops.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Number of drops attributed to bad actor detection in the log.

f5_bigip.log.bad_actor.events.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Number of bad actor events detected in the F5 BIG-IP log.

f5_bigip.log.bad_actor.mitigation.max.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Maximum mitigation value for bad actor events in the log.

f5_bigip.log.bad_actor.mitigation.min.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Minimum mitigation value for bad actor events in the log.

f5_bigip.log.base_mac.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Base MAC address associated with the F5 BIG-IP log entry.

f5_bigip.log.bigip_management.ip.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: ip

Primary management IP address for the F5 BIG-IP device.

f5_bigip.log.bigip_management.ip2.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: ip

Secondary management IP address for the F5 BIG-IP device.

f5_bigip.log.bigip_management.ip_2.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: ip

Alternative secondary management IP address for the F5 BIG-IP device.

f5_bigip.log.blocking_exception_reason.description:

Module: ecs

Boolean value indicating a cold start of a function.

The execution ID of the current function execution.

file.accessed.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: date

Last time the file was accessed.
Note that not all filesystems keep track of access time.

file.attributes.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Array of file attributes.
Attributes names will vary by platform. Here's a non-exhaustive list of values that are expected in this field: archive, compressed, directory, encrypted, execute, hidden, read, readonly, system, write.

file.code_signature.digest_algorithm.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The hashing algorithm used to sign the process.
This value can distinguish signatures when a file is signed multiple times by the same signer but with a different digest algorithm.

file.code_signature.exists.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: boolean

Boolean to capture if a signature is present.

file.code_signature.flags.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The flags used to sign the process.

file.code_signature.signing_id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The identifier used to sign the process.
This is used to identify the application manufactured by a software vendor. The field is relevant to Apple *OS only.

file.code_signature.status.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Additional information about the certificate status.
This is useful for logging cryptographic errors with the certificate validity or trust status. Leave unpopulated if the validity or trust of the certificate was unchecked.

file.code_signature.subject_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Subject name of the code signer

file.code_signature.team_id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The team identifier used to sign the process.
This is used to identify the team or vendor of a software product. The field is relevant to Apple *OS only.

file.code_signature.thumbprint_sha256.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Certificate SHA256 hash that uniquely identifies the code signer.

file.code_signature.timestamp.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: date

Date and time when the code signature was generated and signed.

file.code_signature.trusted.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: boolean

Stores the trust status of the certificate chain.
Validating the trust of the certificate chain may be complicated, and this field should only be populated by tools that actively check the status.

file.code_signature.valid.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: boolean

Boolean to capture if the digital signature is verified against the binary content.
Leave unpopulated if a certificate was unchecked.

file.created.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: date

File creation time.
Note that not all filesystems store the creation time.

file.ctime.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: date

Last time the file attributes or metadata changed.
Note that changes to the file content will update `mtime`. This implies `ctime` will be adjusted at the same time, since `mtime` is an attribute of the file.

file.device.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Device that is the source of the file.

file.directory.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Directory where the file is located. It should include the drive letter, when appropriate.

file.drive_letter.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Drive letter where the file is located. This field is only relevant on Windows.
The value should be uppercase, and not include the colon.

file.elf.architecture.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Machine architecture of the ELF file.

file.elf.byte_order.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Byte sequence of ELF file.

file.elf.cpu_type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

CPU type of the ELF file.

file.elf.creation_date.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: date

Extracted when possible from the file's metadata. Indicates when it was built or compiled. It can also be faked by malware creators.

file.elf.exports.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: flat_object

List of exported element names and types.

file.elf.go_import_hash.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

A hash of the Go language imports in an ELF file excluding standard library imports. An import hash can be used to fingerprint binaries even after recompilation or other code-level transformations have occurred, which would change more traditional hash values.
The algorithm used to calculate the Go symbol hash and a reference implementation are available here: https://github.com/elastic/toutoumomoma

file.elf.go_imports.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: flat_object

List of imported Go language element names and types.

file.elf.go_imports_names_entropy.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Shannon entropy calculation from the list of Go imports.

file.elf.go_imports_names_var_entropy.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Variance for Shannon entropy calculation from the list of Go imports.

file.elf.go_stripped.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: boolean

Set to true if the file is a Go executable that has had its symbols stripped or obfuscated and false if an unobfuscated Go executable.

file.elf.header.abi_version.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Version of the ELF Application Binary Interface (ABI).

file.elf.header.class.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Header class of the ELF file.

file.elf.header.data.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Data table of the ELF header.

file.elf.header.entrypoint.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Header entrypoint of the ELF file.

file.elf.header.object_version.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

file.fork_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

A fork is additional data associated with a filesystem object.
On Linux, a resource fork is used to store additional data with a filesystem object. A file always has at least one fork for the data portion, and additional forks may exist.
On NTFS, this is analogous to an Alternate Data Stream (ADS), and the default data stream for a file is just called $DATA. Zone.Identifier is commonly used by Windows to track contents downloaded from the Internet. An ADS is typically of the form: `C:\path\to\filename.extension:some_fork_name`, and `some_fork_name` is the value that should populate `fork_name`. `filename.extension` should populate `file.name`, and `extension` should populate `file.extension`. The full path, `file.path`, will include the fork name.

IndexerType: keyword

The source of unauthorized user activity detected by Fortinet.

fortinet.unit.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The unit of measurement for the event metric or value.

fortinet.urlfilteridx.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The index of the URL filter applied to the event.

fortinet.used.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The amount used or consumed during the event, such as bandwidth or storage.

fortinet.used_for_type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The type for which the event or object is used.

fortinet.usgsn6.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The IPv6 address of the user-side Serving GPRS Support Node.

fortinet.utmaction.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The UTM (Unified Threat Management) action taken for the event.

fortinet.utmref.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The UTM reference identifier for the event.

fortinet.uuid.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The universally unique identifier associated with the event or session.

fortinet.valid.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Indicates whether the event or session is valid or has passed validation.

fortinet.vcluster.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The virtual cluster involved in the event.

fortinet.vcluster_member.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The member of the virtual cluster involved in the event.

fortinet.vcluster_state.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The state of the virtual cluster during the event.

fortinet.vd.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The virtual domain involved in the event.

fortinet.version.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The version of the device firmware or software involved in the event.

fortinet.violatescore.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The violation score assigned to security policy violations.

fortinet.virus.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name or identifier of the virus detected by Fortinet during traffic inspection or scanning.

fortinet.virusid.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Unique identifier assigned to the detected virus by Fortinet for tracking and reporting purposes.

fortinet.voip_proto.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The Voice over IP protocol used in the network traffic, such as SIP or H.323, as identified by Fortinet.

fortinet.vpntunnel.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name or identifier of the VPN tunnel established or referenced in the event, as recognized by Fortinet.

fortinet.vwlid.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Identifier for the virtual wireless LAN (VWL) involved in the event, as assigned by Fortinet.

fortinet.vwlquality.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Quality metric or status of the virtual wireless LAN (VWL) connection as reported by Fortinet.

fortinet.wanin.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Amount of incoming traffic on the WAN interface, measured and reported by Fortinet.

fortinet.waninfo.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Information about the WAN interface or connection involved in the event.

fortinet.wanout.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Amount of outgoing traffic on the WAN interface, measured and reported by Fortinet.

fortinet.wscode.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The web security code associated with web filtering events.

fortinet.xauthgroup.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The group name associated with the XAuth user, used for access control and policy enforcement.

fortinet.xauthuser.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The username authenticated via extended authentication (XAuth) for VPN or secure network access.

gen_ai.agent.description.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Free-form description of the GenAI agent provided by the application.

gen_ai.agent.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The unique identifier of the GenAI agent.

gen_ai.agent.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Human-readable name of the GenAI agent provided by the application.

gen_ai.operation.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The name of the operation being performed.

gen_ai.output.type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Represents the content type requested by the client.

gen_ai.request.choice.count.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: integer

The target number of candidate completions to return.

gen_ai.request.encoding_formats.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The encoding formats requested in an embeddings operation, if specified.

gen_ai.request.frequency_penalty.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: double

The frequency penalty setting for the GenAI request.

gen_ai.request.max_tokens.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: integer

The maximum number of tokens the model generates for a request.

gen_ai.request.model.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The name of the GenAI model a request is being made to.

gen_ai.request.presence_penalty.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: double

The presence penalty setting for the GenAI request.

gen_ai.request.seed.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: integer

Requests with same seed value more likely to return same result.

gen_ai.request.stop_sequences.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

List of sequences that the model will use to stop generating further tokens.

gen_ai.request.temperature.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: double

The temperature setting for the GenAI request.

gen_ai.request.top_k.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: double

The top_k sampling setting for the GenAI request.

gen_ai.request.top_p.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: double

The top_p sampling setting for the GenAI request.

gen_ai.response.finish_reasons.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Array of reasons the model stopped generating tokens, corresponding to each generation received.

gen_ai.response.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The unique identifier for the completion.

gen_ai.response.model.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The name of the model that generated the response.

gen_ai.system.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The Generative AI product as identified by the client or server instrumentation.

gen_ai.token.type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The type of token being counted.

gen_ai.tool.call.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The tool call identifier.

gen_ai.tool.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the tool utilized by the agent.

gen_ai.tool.type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Type of the tool utilized by the agent

gen_ai.usage.input_tokens.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: integer

The number of tokens used in the GenAI input (prompt).

gen_ai.usage.output_tokens.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: integer

The number of tokens used in the GenAI response (completion).

group.domain.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the directory the group is a member of.
For example, an LDAP or Active Directory domain name.

group.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Unique identifier for the group on the system/platform.

group.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the group.

host.architecture.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Operating system architecture.

host.boot.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Linux boot uuid taken from /proc/sys/kernel/random/boot_id. Note the boot_id value from /proc may or may not be the same in containers as on the host. Some container runtimes will bind mount a new boot_id value onto the proc file in each container.

host.cpu.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: object

CPU-related data.

cores.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Number of CPU cores.

name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

CPU Model name.

speed.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

CPU clock speed.

usage.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: scaled_float

Percent CPU used which is normalized by the number of CPU cores and it ranges from 0 to 1.
Scaling factor: 1000.
For example: For a two core host, this value should be the average of the two cores, between 0 and 1.

host.disk.read.bytes.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The total number of bytes (gauge) read successfully (aggregated from all disks) since the last metric collection.

host.disk.write.bytes.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The total number of bytes (gauge) written successfully (aggregated from all disks) since the last metric collection.

host.domain.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the domain of which the host is a member.
For example, on Windows this could be the host's Active Directory domain or NetBIOS domain name. For Linux this could be the domain of the host's LDAP provider.

host.geo.city_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

City name.

host.geo.continent_code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Two-letter code representing continent's name.

host.geo.continent_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the continent.

host.geo.country_iso_code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Country ISO code.

host.geo.country_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Country name.

host.geo.location.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: geo_point

Longitude and latitude.

host.geo.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

User-defined description of a location, at the level of granularity they care about.
Could be the name of their data centers, the floor number, if this describes a local physical entity, city names.
Not typically used in automated geolocation.

host.geo.postal_code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Postal code associated with the location.
Values appropriate for this field may also be known as a postcode or ZIP code and will vary widely from country to country.

host.geo.region_iso_code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Region ISO code.

host.geo.region_name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Region name.

host.geo.timezone.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The time zone of the location, such as IANA time zone name.

host.hostname.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Hostname of the host.
It normally contains what the `hostname` command returns on the host machine.

host.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Unique host id.
As hostname is not always unique, use values that are meaningful in your environment.
Example: The current usage of `beat.name`.

host.ip.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: ip

Host ip addresses.

host.mac.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Host MAC addresses.
The notation format from RFC 7042 is suggested: Each octet (that is, 8-bit byte) is represented by two [uppercase] hexadecimal digits giving the value of the octet as an unsigned integer. Successive octets are separated by a hyphen.

host.memory.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: object

Memory-related data.

free.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Free memory in MB.

total.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Total memory in MB.

used.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: object

Used memory-related data.

percentage.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Used memory percentage.

host.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Name of the host.
It can contain what hostname returns on Unix systems, the fully qualified domain name (FQDN), or a name specified by the user. The recommended value is the lowercase FQDN of the host.

host.network.egress.bytes.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The number of bytes (gauge) sent out on all network interfaces by the host since the last metric collection.

host.network.egress.drops.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Number of dropped transmitted packets.

host.network.egress.errors.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Number of transmission errors.

host.network.egress.packets.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The number of packets (gauge) sent out on all network interfaces by the host since the last metric collection.

host.network.egress.queue.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Transmit queue length.

host.network.ingress.bytes.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The number of bytes received (gauge) on all network interfaces by the host since the last metric collection.

host.network.ingress.drops.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Number of dropped received packets.

host.network.ingress.errors.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Number of reception errors.

host.network.ingress.packets.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The number of packets (gauge) received on all network interfaces by the host since the last metric collection.

host.network.ingress.queue.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Receive queue length.

host.os.family.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

OS family (such as redhat, debian, freebsd, windows).

host.os.full.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Operating system name, including the version or code name.

host.os.kernel.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Operating system kernel version as a raw string.

host.os.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Operating system name, without the version.

host.os.platform.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Operating system platform (such centos, ubuntu, windows).

host.os.type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Use the `os.type` field to categorize the operating system into one of the broad commercial families.
If the OS you're dealing with is not listed as an expected value, the field should not be populated. Please let us know by opening an issue with ECS, to propose its addition.

host.os.version.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Operating system version as a raw string.

host.pid_ns_ino.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

This is the inode number of the namespace in the namespace file system (nsfs). Unsigned int inum in include/linux/ns_common.h.

host.risk.calculated_level.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

A risk classification level calculated by an internal system as part of entity analytics and entity risk scoring.

host.risk.calculated_score.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: float

A risk classification score calculated by an internal system as part of entity analytics and entity risk scoring.

host.risk.calculated_score_norm.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: float

A risk classification score calculated by an internal system as part of entity analytics and entity risk scoring, and normalized to a range of 0 to 100.

host.risk.static_level.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

A risk classification level obtained from outside the system, such as from some external Threat Intelligence Platform.

host.risk.static_score.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: float

A risk classification score obtained from outside the system, such as from some external Threat Intelligence Platform.

host.risk.static_score_norm.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: float

A risk classification score obtained from outside the system, such as from some external Threat Intelligence Platform, and normalized to a range of 0 to 100.

host.type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Type of host.
For Cloud providers this can be the machine type like `t2.medium`. If vm, this could be the container, for example, or other information meaningful in your environment.

host.uptime.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Seconds the host has been up.

http.request.body.bytes.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Size in bytes of the request body.

http.request.body.content.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The full HTTP request body.

http.request.bytes.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Total size in bytes of the request (body and headers).

http.request.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

A unique identifier for each HTTP request to correlate logs between clients and servers in transactions.
The id may be contained in a non-standard HTTP header, such as `X-Request-ID` or `X-Correlation-ID`.

http.request.method.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

HTTP request method.
The value should retain its casing from the original event. For example, `GET`, `get`, and `GeT` are all considered valid values for this field.

http.request.mime_type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Mime type of the body of the request.
This value must only be populated based on the content of the request body, not on the `Content-Type` header. Comparing the mime type of a request with the request's Content-Type header can be helpful in detecting threats or misconfigured clients.

http.request.referrer.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Referrer for this HTTP request.

http.response.body.bytes.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Size in bytes of the response body.

http.response.body.content.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The full HTTP response body.

http.response.bytes.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Total size in bytes of the response (body and headers).

http.response.mime_type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Mime type of the body of the response.
This value must only be populated based on the content of the response body, not on the `Content-Type` header. Comparing the mime type of a response with the response's Content-Type header can be helpful in detecting misconfigured servers.

http.response.status_code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

HTTP response status code.

http.version.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

HTTP version.

icmp.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: object

An object containing Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) related information.

code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The ICMP code field, used in conjunction with the ICMP type to provide specific error information in ICMP messages.

type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The ICMP type field, indicating the type of ICMP message (e.g., echo request, echo reply, destination unreachable).

igmp.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: object

An object containing Internet Group Management Protocol (IGMP) related information.

type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The IGMP (Internet Group Management Protocol) type field, indicating the type of IGMP message used for multicast group management.

iis.bytes_received_by_client.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

This is the number of bytes received by the client.

iis.bytes_sent_by_server.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

This is the number of bytes sent by the server.

iis.sub_status.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

This field represents the substatus error code in the iis log.

iis.win32_status.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

This field represents the Windows status code in the iis log.

input.type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Type of input from which the event was received.

interface.alias.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Interface alias as reported by the system, typically used in firewall implementations for e.g. inside, outside, or dmz logical interface naming.

interface.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Interface ID as reported by an observer (typically SNMP interface ID).

interface.mtu.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Maximum transmission unit size.

interface.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Interface name as reported by the system.

interface.state.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

State of the network interface.

interface.type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Interface type.

iptables.ether_type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

EtherType field from Ethernet frame indicating protocol type (2048 for IPv4 34525 for IPv6)

iptables.flow_label.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

IPv6 flow label field used for QoS management (IPv6 packets only)

iptables.fragment_flags.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

IP fragmentation flags such as "DF" (Don't Fragment) indicating packet fragmentation control

iptables.icmp_code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

ICMP message code providing additional information about the ICMP message (ICMP packets only)

iptables.icmp_seq.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

ICMP sequence number for echo request/reply correlation (ICMP packets only)

iptables.icmp_type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

ICMP message type indicating the purpose of the ICMP message (ICMP packets only)

iptables.id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

IP packet identification field used for fragment reassembly

iptables.input_device.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Network interface on which the packet was received (IN field from iptables log)

iptables.length.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Total packet length in bytes (LEN field from iptables log)

iptables.mark.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Netfilter mark value assigned to the packet for advanced routing/filtering (MARK field when present)

iptables.output_device.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Network interface on which packet would be sent (OUT field from iptables log empty for dropped packets)

iptables.precedence_bits.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

IP precedence bits indicating packet priority level (PREC field converted from hex)

iptables.tcp_flags.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

TCP control flags present in the packet (SYN ACK FIN RST PSH URG) (TCP packets only)

iptables.tcp_reserved_bits.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Reserved bits in TCP header (RES field converted from hex) (TCP packets only)

iptables.tcp_window.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

TCP window size indicating receiver buffer space (WINDOW field) (TCP packets only)

iptables.tos.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Type of Service field from IP header indicating packet handling priority (TOS or TC field converted from hex)

iptables.ttl.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Time To Live value decremented at each router hop (TTL or HOPLIMIT field)

log.file.path.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Full path to the log file this event came from, including the file name. It should include the drive letter, when appropriate.
If the event wasn't read from a log file, do not populate this field.

log.level.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Original log level of the log event.
If the source of the event provides a log level or textual severity, this is the one that goes in `log.level`. If your source doesn't specify one, you may put your event transport's severity here (e.g. Syslog severity).
Some examples are `warn`, `err`, `i`, `informational`.

log.logger.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The name of the logger inside an application. This is usually the name of the class which initialized the logger, or can be a custom name.

log.origin.file.line.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The line number of the file containing the source code which originated the log event.

log.origin.file.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The name of the file containing the source code which originated the log event.
Note that this field is not meant to capture the log file. The correct field to capture the log file is `log.file.path`.

log.origin.function.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The name of the function or method which originated the log event.

log.syslog.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: object

The Syslog metadata of the event, if the event was transmitted via Syslog. Please see RFCs 5424 or 3164.

appname.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The device or application that originated the Syslog message, if available.

facility.code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The Syslog numeric facility of the log event, if available.
According to RFCs 5424 and 3164, this value should be an integer between 0 and 23.

facility.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The Syslog text-based facility of the log event, if available.

hostname.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The hostname, FQDN, or IP of the machine that originally sent the Syslog message. This is sourced from the hostname field of the syslog header. Depending on the environment, this value may be different from the host that handled the event, especially if the host handling the events is acting as a collector.

msgid.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

An identifier for the type of Syslog message, if available. Only applicable for RFC 5424 messages.

priority.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

Syslog numeric priority of the event, if available.
According to RFCs 5424 and 3164, the priority is 8 * facility + severity. This number is therefore expected to contain a value between 0 and 191.

procid.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The process name or ID that originated the Syslog message, if available.

severity.code.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: long

The Syslog numeric severity of the log event, if available.
If the event source publishing via Syslog provides a different numeric severity value (e.g. firewall, IDS), your source's numeric severity should go to `event.severity`. If the event source does not specify a distinct severity, you can optionally copy the Syslog severity to `event.severity`.

severity.name.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The Syslog numeric severity of the log event, if available.
If the event source publishing via Syslog provides a different severity value (e.g. firewall, IDS), your source's text severity should go to `log.level`. If the event source does not specify a distinct severity, you can optionally copy the Syslog severity to `log.level`.

structured_data.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: flat_object

Structured data expressed in RFC 5424 messages, if available. These are key-value pairs formed from the structured data portion of the syslog message, as defined in RFC 5424 Section 6.3.

version.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

The version of the Syslog protocol specification. Only applicable for RFC 5424 messages.

macos_uls.auth_method.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Authentication method used during a login attempt (e.g., `keyboard-interactive`, `pam`, or `smartcard`). Useful for access auditing.

macos_uls.ipc_type.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Type of Interprocess Communication (IPC) mechanism involved in spawning a process (e.g., `mach`, `socket`). Useful for process activity analysis.

macos_uls.macos_entitlement.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

Specific macOS entitlement or capability allowing an executable to bypass certain system restrictions. Useful for detecting privilege usage or bypass attempts.

message.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

For log events the message field contains the log message, optimized for viewing in a log viewer.
For structured logs without an original message field, other fields can be concatenated to form a human-readable summary of the event.
If multiple messages exist, they can be combined into one message.

microsoft.dhcp.correlation_id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

An identifier used to correlate DHCP events or logs across systems for tracking and debugging purposes.

microsoft.dhcp.dhc_id.description:
Module: ecs
IndexerType: keyword

modsecurity.audit_data_messages.description:

Captures audit log messages generated by ModSecurity on Apache, offering insights into detected security events.

modsecurity.audit_data_server.description:
Module: ecs
